title: E.T. child star Henry Thomas arrested for allegedly driving under the influence
text:
Henry was arrested on Monday night (Picture: Washington County Sheriff\’s Office via AP)

E.T child star Henry Thomas has been arrested for allegedly driving under the influence.

The actor – best known for riding a bicycle playing Elliott in the classic movie – was arrested in Monday in Oregon after police were called around 8.30pm to report that a car was stopped in the middle of a residential intersection.

Thomas, 48, was allegedly found passed out behind the wheel, with Tualatin Police Department officers waking him up.

The star was taken to Washington County Jail on suspicion of a DUI ‘based on other signs of being intoxicated’, although according to TMZ, there was no smell of alcohol in the vehicle.

Henry is best known for playing Elliott in E.T. (Picture: Moviestore/REX/Shutterstock)

Henry has been released from jail (Picture: Albert L. Ortega/Getty Images)

Here, he was booked for misdemeanor driving under the influence of intoxicants, and had his mugshot taken.

Henry was released from jail on Tuesday morning at around 9.30am.

The actor is best known for his role as Elliott in Steven Spielberg’s 1982 classic E.T, for which he was nominated for the Golden Globe for Best Actor and for which he won the Best Actor honour at the Young Artist Awards.

More recently, Thomas landed a role as Young Hugh Crain in Netflix’s hit The Haunting Of Hill House, for which he landed a Saturn Award for Best Actor in Streaming Presentation.

Henry shot to fame in the early 80s (Picture: Ron Galella, Ltd/Ron Galella Collection via Getty Images)

Henry recently starred in The Haunting Of Hill House (Picture: Emma McIntyre/Getty Images for Netflix)

The supernatural horror was a huge success upon its release last October, and has been renewed for a second series, which will be an anthology with some of the cast playing new characters.

Thomas is confirmed to be returning for the second season, due out in 2020.

Other big screen productions Henry has starred in include Dear John, Gangs Of New York and Gerald’s Game, while on TV, he has appeared in shows including Law & Order, CSI and The Mentalist over the years.

He is also set to star in the DC series Stargirl next year.

Henry has been married to wife Annalee Fery since 2009, with whom he has two children, Evelyn and Henry; he also has a daughter Hazel with ex-wife Marie Zielcke, and was also previously married to Kelly Hill.
